description: It was a crowded season this year, with 36 eligible musicals and plays opening on Broadway stages. Here are the winners of the 77th Tony Awards.
title: Tony Awards 2024: The complete list of winners

description: Next week, President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on CNN. The network announced the rules this weekend.
title: President Biden and former President Trump face off in CNN debate next week

description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Matthew Holehouse, British political correspondent for The Economist, about the upcoming UK election.
title: Could the U.K. election mean an off-ramp from personality politics?

description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Alice Hill, a former senior director for resilience policy on the National Security Council, about how extreme weather threatens elections globally.
title: National security expert warns that extreme weather threatens democracy

description: The fire, which scorched over 12,000 acres in less than a day, has forced the evacuation of about 1,200 people, California fire officials said. The blaze was 2% contained as of Sunday afternoon.
title: A fast-moving wildfire spreads north of Los Angeles, forcing evacuations

description: A sweltering heat wave is bearing down on a large swath of the U.S., creating potentially dangerous conditions for millions of people in multiple states.
title: Millions from the Midwest to the Northeast prepare for a weeklong heat wave

description: Protests have broken out across Brazil after lawmakers attempted to fast track legislation that would equate abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy to murder.
title: Brazil's far-right introduces bill that equates abortion after 22 weeks to murder

description: Muslims around the world are celebrating Eid al-Adha, the Feast of the Sacrifice. But in Gaza, which aid groups say is on the brink of famine, food is hard to come by this year let alone meat.
title: Muslims in Gaza pass a somber Eid al-Adha on the brink of famine

description: In the Democratic Republic of Congo, three Americans are among dozens of people on trial for a failed coup attempt. NPR's Lauren Frayer talks to independent journalist Emmet Livingstone.
title: 3 Americans are on trial for a failed coup in the Democratic Republic of Congo

description: NPR's Lauren Frayer talks with Wired senior writer Andy Greenberg about how healthcare hacks are on the increase after a major attack against Change Healthcare earlier this year.
title: The U.S. healthcare industry has been the target of two ransomware attacks this year

description: NPR explores a secret vault under London’s Old War Office, where the UK kept fake passports for undercover agents abroad. Behind door #007 is where Ian Fleming hatched his famous character in WWII.
title: A peek inside London's old war office, the place of inspiration for James Bond

description: NPR's Lauren Frayer talks to soccer commentator Roger Bennett about the two major international soccer tournament this summer: the European Championship and Copa America, which the US will host.
title: Summer of soccer: Euros 2024 kick off with Copa America to follow

description: An innovative program in Colombia gives men a chance to master the skills needed to be a hands-on dad — and become closer to their kids along the way.
title: Wanna be a good dad? A 'School for Men' teaches diapering, ponytail making

description: Democrats have an advantage with young voters: they voted for President Biden by a 24-point margin in 2020. But, inside Turning Point's conference, it's clear young conservatives are all in on Trump.
title: It's easy to believe young voters could back Trump at young conservative conference

description: For Father's Day, we asked readers about the most influential father figures in their lives. From dads to husbands to single moms who stepped up, these are the people who shaped readers' lives.
title: Protectors, confidants, supporters: readers share stories of the dads that shaped them

description: The Kunsthaus Zurich museum will remove works by artists including Van Gogh, Monet and Gauguin from public view on June 20 as it investigates their provenance.
title: A Swiss museum will remove 5 paintings potentially looted by Nazis

description: Boeing says a deal to buy fuselage-maker Spirit AeroSystems will help it control quality and safety. But a whistleblower who worked at Spirit for over a decade warns its problems won’t be easy to fix.
title: As Boeing looks to buy a key 737 supplier, a whistleblower says the problems run deep

description: They sit behind a console that looks like the bridge of a spaceship and use complicated technology to bring words from the actors mouth to the audience's ears.
title: When you can hear every word, thank the sound mixers

description: Nine people were injured, including two young children and their mother, after a shooter opened fire at a splash pad in a Detroit suburb where families gathered to escape the summer heat Saturday.
title: A shooting at splash pad in Detroit suburb injures 9, including 2 children

description: Donald Trump on Saturday night suggested President Joe Biden “should have to take a cognitive test," only to confuse who administered the test to him in the next sentence.
title: Trump challenges Biden to cognitive test, but confuses name of doctor who tested him

description: The Israeli military on Sunday announced a “tactical pause” in its offensive in the southern Gaza Strip to allow the deliveries of increased quantities of humanitarian aid.
title: Israeli military announces daily 'tactical pause' in Rafah area to get aid into Gaza
